climbs.name: She's So Unusual
climbs.fa: Todd Swain and Peggy Buckey, Mar. 1986

content.location: at the right end of the southwest face

content.description: Start about 15 feet right of She's So Unusual at a very obvious left leaning dike. The dike is roughly ten inches wide and at the right end of the southwest face of Pet Rock. Climb the initial overhanging section of the dike (crux) to easier ground and the top.
content.protection: Some very small cams and small wires can be used to kind of protect the crux. Medium cams and some anchor rope are needed for a top rope.
content.location: Start about 15 feet right of She's So Unusual at a very obvious left leaning dike. The dike is roughly ten inches wide and at the right end of the southwest face of Pet Rock.

content.description:
This route is located about eight feet right of She's So Unusual. Start at a vertical crack/seam that runs through a bulge. Climb up along the crack (crux; V1) to a horizontal, then up and slightly left on good holds to lower angled rock and the summit.

V1: It's possible to climb directly over the bulge a few feet left of the crack (no protection).
content.protection: Small cams protect the crux and lower portion of the route. The upper section is unprotected. The anchor requires medium cams and some anchor rope.
content.location: This route is located about eight feet right of She's So Unusual. Start at a vertical crack/seam that runs through a bulge just off the ground. This crack is about six feet left of a very obvious left leaning dike.

content.description:
Sustained crux comes immediately after starting from the low-angle slab into the thin tips crack.  Make some delicate smeary steps up the blunt arete just to the right of the crack to make a longish reach to a one of the few tenable locks.  The strenuousness eases as you reach the ledge and join Excitable Boy.

The beta photo doesn't do it justice.  Then again, it is still harder than it looks in person.
content.protection: Thin cams for the crux.  Medium for the anchors.
content.location: The thin right slanting crack ~10' left of Excitable Boy.

content.description: a nice short route Â– mixed crack and face
content.location: near the right end of the southwest face

climbs.name: Excitable Boy
climbs.fa: Todd Swain and Peggy Buckey, Mar. 1986

content.description: A short, fun lieback and hand crack
content.location: on the left end of the southwest face
